movements.notes: dolcts. The first two bars are repeated in the Berlin and Rome MSS.
sotto voce. Repeat of the minuetto followed by:

sources.first_edition: 1785, Paris, Sieber: (Op. 33), no. 1 of Six quatuors pour deux violons, alto et basse composés par L. Boccherini oeuvre XXXIII. Prix 9s. à Paris, chez Sieber musicien, rue Honoré, la Porte Cochere entre les rues des vieilles Etuves et d'Orleans, n° 85. Plate no. 445.
sources.later_editions: 1798, Paris, Pleyel: Op. 39 no. 2 (Book 1 no. 2; for title, see No. 234).

entries.notes: Le Mercure de France for February 1785 announces the publication of Six Quatuors... del Signor Boccherini, oeuvre trente-troisième. Prix 9 liv. A Lyon, chez Castaud, Libraire et Marchand de Musique, place de la Comédie, et à Paris, chez Carcanouilles, rue Saint Julien le Pauvre n° 3. Is this an independent edition of which we have no knowledge, or is it, as we consider more probable, the Sieber edition, with an indication of the addresses where it may be obtained?
